pylinuxtoolkit.rpi.pi_commands_event module¶

Contains the PiCommandsEvent class, an event that is triggered when a RaspberryPi command is run.

class pylinuxtoolkit.rpi.pi_commands_event.PiCommandsEvent[source]¶

Bases: object

An event that is triggered when a RaspberryPi command is run.

IS_PI0 = Namespace(pi.commands.is_pizero)¶
IS_PI1 = Namespace(pi.commands.is_pione)¶
IS_PI2 = Namespace(pi.commands.is_pitwo)¶
IS_PI4 = Namespace(pi.commands.is_pifour)¶
ROOT = Namespace(pi.commands)¶
fire(namespace: pystdlib.event.Namespace, **kwargs)[source]¶

Fires an event. All functions of events that match event are invoked with kwargs in the exact order of their registration. Wildcards might be applied.

Parameters

  • namespace – the event to fire

  • kwargs – keyword args to pass to handlers

on_command(namespace: pystdlib.event.Namespace, handler: Optional[Callable[[pystdlib.bash.bash_command.BashCommand], Any]] = None, ttl: int = - 1)[source]¶

Registers a function to the ‘new_handler’ event.

NOTE: type hinting on parameters is not required but, if used, is enforced to match the event signature.

Parameters

  • namespace – the event namespace to register

  • handler – the function to add as handler. When None, decorator usage is assumed. Returns the function.

  • ttl – the amount of times to listen. Negative values mean infinity.

pylinuxtoolkit.rpi.raspberry_pi module¶

Contains the RaspberryPi class.

class pylinuxtoolkit.rpi.raspberry_pi.SSHConfig(rpi: pylinuxtoolkit.rpi.raspberry_pi.RaspberryPi)[source]¶

Bases: pylinuxtoolkit.rpi.raspberry_pi.BaseConfig

This config object contains all the ssh related settings.

connect(ssh_login_timeout: int = 10, print_prompt: bool = False, print_ssh_connection_msgs: bool = False, print_ssh_login_success: bool = False, print_ssh_mod: bool = False)[source]¶

Connects to the ssh client and keeps the connection open.

Parameters

  • ssh_login_timeout – the timeout to use for ssh login

  • print_prompt – if true prints the prompt to the output

  • print_ssh_connection_msgs – if true prints a message on ssh connect and disconnect

  • print_ssh_login_success – if true prints a message on ssh login success

  • print_ssh_mod – if true prints the server’s mod(Message of the Day) on login

set_login_info(hostname: str, username: str, password: Optional[str] = None, port: int = 22, ssh_key: Optional[Union[str, bytes, os.PathLike[str], os.PathLike[bytes]]] = None)[source]¶

Sets the required login info for the ssh connection.

Parameters

  • hostname – the network hostname port ip address of the computer to connect to

  • username – the username

  • password – the password

  • port – the port (Default is 22)

  • ssh_key – the ssh auth key filename (Optional)

Bases: pylinuxtoolkit.rpi.raspberry_pi.BaseConfig

This config object contains all the system related settings.

pylinuxtoolkit.rpi.settings module¶

Contains the Settings and SettingMonitor classes, that stores and monitors new commands with a thread and updates the GUI or runs other tasks.

class pylinuxtoolkit.rpi.settings.SettingMonitor(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: pystdlib.logged.Logged

Contains a thread that monitors new commands and updates the GUI or runs other tasks

is_running() → bool[source]¶

Returns True if the monitor is running.

Returns

True if the monitor is running

request_processed_list() → NoReturn[source]¶

Requests the monitor to print the current list to the logger.

request_termination() → NoReturn[source]¶

Requests the monitor to stop running.

start_monitoring() → NoReturn[source]¶

Starts the monitor.
